sinks.name: TEE_Free
sinks.reason: Passing a tainted pointer can cause memory corruption such as double free or invalid free, leading to potential security vulnerabilities.

sinks.name: TEE_GenerateRandom
sinks.reason: Potential memory corruption or arbitrary memory write if the output buffer pointer is attacker-controlled or tainted.

sinks.name: TEE_GenerateRandom
sinks.reason: Potential buffer overflow or out-of-bounds write if the requested random data length is attacker-controlled or tainted.

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on size parameter could lead to integer overflow or excessive memory allocation causing resource exhaustion or memory corruption in subsequent use
